intro: Serapias lingua var. rubescens, commonly known as the Red-tongued Sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Rockcress (Capparaceae) and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and linear, while its flowers are borne in clusters at the ends of the stems. This variety is distinguished by its reddish-pink markings on the petals, which give it its common name.
